task.title: Installing IBM DTFJ feature for IBM dumps

taskbody.context: Install the IBM Diagnostic Tool Framework for Java feature from an IBM download site to add to Eclipse Memory Analyzer the capability to read and analyze dumps generated by IBM virtual machines for Java.

step.cmd:
Select
Work with:
IBM Diagnostic Tool Framework for Java - http://public.dhe.ibm.com/ibmdl/export/pub/software/websphere/runtimes/tools/dtfj/
step.stepresult:
In the main table the following appears:
IBM Monitoring and Diagnostic Tools

step.cmd:
Select
IBM Monitoring and Diagnostic Tools Diagnostic Tool Framework for Java

step.stepresult:
At the bottom of the dialog this progress message appears: Calculating requirements and dependencies. The dialog changes to: Install Details Review the items to be installed.
Diagnostic Tool Framework for Java

The dialog changes to: Review Licenses
Licenses must be reviewed and accepted before the software can be installed.

step.cmd: Select I accept the terms of the license agreement

step.stepresult:
The dialog closes, then at the bottom of the Eclipse Memory Analyzer window appears the message Installing Software then after a while a new dialog window appears: Do you trust these certificates? In the dialog are the following certificate details:
IBM Canada Ltd; null; IBM Canada Ltd

step.info: This indicates that you trust the provider of certificates provided.
step.stepresult: The dialog closes, installation continues with the Installing Software indicating progress. When installation is complete a new dialog appears: Software Updates Would you like to restart Eclipse Memory Analyzer to apply the changes?
Eclipse Memory Analyzer shuts down and restarts with the DTFJ feature installed.

step.cmd:
Check that the features is correctly installed using
File Open
step.stepresult: A file dialog appears: Open Snapshot

The following list drops down:
All Known Formats HPROF binary heap dumps IBM 1.4.2 SDFFIBM DTFJ feature versions >= 1.12.29003.201808011034 do not have this option IBM Javadumps IBM SDK for Java (J9) system dumps IBM SDK for Java Portable Heap Dumps All Files
Installation of the DTFJ feature is complete.
